results.title: Black Orpheus = Orfeu negro
results.creator_credit: Marcel Camus, Sacha Gordine and Lopert Films
results.brief_description: Orfeu Negro is an transposition of the story of Orpheus and Euridyce to the modern city of Rio da Janeiro during the Carnival. It is interpreted by a cast of non-professional actors. (Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1959 - Palme d’or ; Academy Awards 1959 - Best Foreign Film) Cast includes Breno Higeno-Mello, Marpessa Dawn, Lourdes de Oliveira, Lea Garcia, Alexandro Constantino, Waldemar da Souza, Jorge Dos Santos and Aurino Cassanio. In Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: Black or White (1991)
results.brief_description: Michael Jackson’s “Black or White” music video premiered on MTV, BET, VH1, and Fox, achieving their highest Nielsen ratings ever at the time, on November 14, 1991. The video was directed by John Landis, who previously directed “Thriller”.

constellations_other.name: Transformations
constellations_other.description: Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

results.title: Black on white
results.creator_credit: John Read, Arts Council of Great Britain and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A selection of 200 illustrations are used in this survey of cartoon and caricature in Britain over the past 250 years. In dealing with the present century the film shows work by artists such as Bateman, Port, Fougasse, Ronald Searle, Osbert Lancaster, Gibs, Vicky and David Low. Low is shown at work on a cartoon of Clement Attlee and Sir Winston Churchill. Other artists whose work is featured include James Gillroy, Thomas Rowlandson, George Cruikshank, Charles Keene, George du Maurier, John Tenneil, Phil May and Max Beerbohm.

results.title: Black Narcissus
results.creator_credit: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Archers Film Productions and GFD
results.brief_description: Obstacles in the life of a nun’s community high in the Himalayas range from a cynical British agent, suspicious natives, longings of the flesh, problems of faith and insanity to the arduous surrounding terrain. The mission prospers, but often at the expense of spiritual progress and although the nuns eventually retreat from the mission and the threatening terrain it is with a sense of having achieved some small spiritual gains. “One of the few genuinely erotic films to emerge from these sexually staid isles” said one critic. The glorious Oscar winning photography was a trick because it was shot in a London studio and backyard garden. The title refers to the intoxicating perfume worn by Indian Prince Sabu in his last major role. Based on the novel by Rumer Godden. Stars Deborah Kerr, David Farrar, Sabu, Jean Simmons, Flora Robson and Esmond Knight.

results.title: Black music in America: the 70's
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and BMA
results.brief_description: An overview of the world of black music in the 1970’s. Presents a musical journey from Motown to disco of Donna Summer. Includes clips of over seventy-five groups showing the growth and influence of black music in this decade. Narrators are Isaac Hayes and Dionne Warwick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Black music in America: from then till now
results.creator_credit: Hugh A Robertson, William H. Barnett, Richard Kerns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents the history of black people’s contribution to American music from the pioneer days until 1970. Features among others; Louis Armstrong, Mahalia Jackson, Duke Ellington, Count Bassie, Nina Simone and what is reported to be the only footage of Bessie Smith.

results.title: Black Mirror: USS Callister
results.brief_description: Capt. Robert Daly presides over his crew with wisdom and courage. But a new recruit will soon discover nothing on this spaceship is what it seems.

constellations_other.name: Superhero special effects
constellations_other.description: VFX talent isn't limited to just one studio that makes superhero blockbusters.

results.title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
results.creator_credit: Charlie Brooker, Russell McLean, Caroline Harris, Catrin Meredydd, David Slade and House of Tomorrow
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a dark fantasy novel into a video game. A mind-bending tale with multiple endings.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.title: Black Mirror
results.brief_description: A contemporary reworking of The Twilight Zone format that taps into our collective unease about our world, particularly our relationship to technology, Black Mirror explores the everyday dystopia we may already be living in.

constellations_other.name: Good vibrations
constellations_other.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

constellations_other.name: The perils of new technology
constellations_other.description: Explores our fascination with, and our anxiety surrounding, new technology, which is something that can bring about significant cultural change but also danger.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.description:
A contemporary British re-working of The Twilight Zone with stories that tap into the collective unease about our modern world.

Over the last ten years, technology has transformed almost every aspect of our lives before we’ve had time to stop and question it. In every home; on every desk; in every palm - a plasma screen; a monitor; a smartphone - a black mirror of our 21st Century existence.
